comments.author: John
comments.content: I made a modified version tonight. Replaced "Porcini" with a "three-mushroom mix" -- crimini, oyster, and shiitake, and I didn't make the confit...just used some sun-dried-tomatoes-in-oil that I had in the house already. And I used grits instead of cornmeal for the polenta. The results were great -- not a real BLENDING of flavors, but a bunch of distinct flavors and textures that complemented each other and worked well. On the side, I made the Persian Zucchini recipe, which was a big hit as well (although your notion of "medium" zucchini and mine must be different, because 6 of mine covered my largest baking dish about 1.5 layers deep, and 8 would have overflowed).
